name: OpenMS
text_content:
Tool Name: OpenMS
Description: Open source library and a collection of tools and interfaces for the analysis of mass spectrometry data. Includes over 200 standalone (TOPP) tools that can be combined to a workflow with the integrated workflow editor TOPPAS. Raw and intermediate mass spectrometry data can be visualised with the included viewer TOPPView.
Functions: Spectral analysis, Target-Decoy, Retention time prediction, Mass spectra calibration, Peptide identification, Parsing, Splitting, Protein identification, Peak detection, Annotation, Deisotoping, Prediction and recognition (protein), Labeled quantification, Standardisation and normalisation, Comparison, Protein quantification, Isotope-coded protein label, Data handling, iTRAQ, Label-free quantification, Mass spectrum visualisation, Chromatographic alignment, Formatting, Protein feature detection
Topics: Proteomics, Proteomics experiment, Metabolomics
Homepage: http://www.openms.de
Documentation: http://ftp.mi.fu-berlin.de/pub/OpenMS/release-documentation/html/index.html

name: hictkpy
text_content:
Tool Name: hictkpy
Description: Python bindings for hictk: read and write .cool and .hic files directly from Python
Functions: N/A
Topics: Bioinformatics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/paulsengroup/hictkpy
Documentation: https://hictkpy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/

name: hictk
text_content:
Tool Name: hictk
Description: Blazing fast toolkit to work with .hic and .cool files
Functions: N/A
Topics: Bioinformatics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/paulsengroup/hictk
Documentation: https://hictk.readthedocs.io/en/stable/index.html

name: neXtProt
text_content:
Tool Name: neXtProt
Description: neXtProt was an innovative knowledge platform dedicated to human proteins. This resource contained a wealth of high-quality data on all the human proteins that are produced by the 20'000 protein-coding genes found in the human genome. The content of neXtProt was continuously extended so as to provide many more carefully selected data sets and analysis tools. neXtProt data and tools have been archived.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Query and retrieval, Protein structure analysis, Visualisation
Topics: Proteomics, Protein variants, Rare diseases, Proteins, Protein modifications, Model organisms
Homepage: https://www.expasy.org/archives/nextprot
Documentation:

name: prolfquapp
text_content:
Tool Name: prolfquapp
Description: A command-line tool for differential expression analysis in quantitative proteomics
Functions: Validation, Expression data visualisation, Differential protein expression profiling
Topics: Proteomics
Homepage: https://github.com/prolfqua/prolfquapp
Documentation: https://github.com/prolfqua/prolfquapp/blob/master/README.md

name: DISULFIND
text_content:
Tool Name: DISULFIND
Description: DISULFIND is a server for predicting the disulfide bonding state of cysteines and their disulfide connectivity given a protein sequence.
Functions: Protein cysteine and disulfide bond assignment, Protein sequence analysis, Prediction and recognition, Protein feature detection
Topics: Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Gene and protein families, Proteins, Protein sites, features and motifs, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://disulfind.dsi.unifi.it/
Documentation: http://disulfind.dsi.unifi.it/help.php

name: Spacedust
text_content:
Tool Name: Spacedust
Description: Spacedust is a modular toolkit for identification of conserved gene clusters among multiple genomes based on homology and conservation of gene neighborhood. Spacedust adapts the fast and sensitive structure comparisons of Foldseek and homology search capabilities of MMseqs2. It introduces a novel approach of aggregating sets of homologous hits between pairs of genomes and identifies cluster of hits with conserved gene neighborhood between each using agglomerative hierarchical clustering algorithm.
Functions: N/A
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/soedinglab/spacedust/
Documentation:

name: Sequali
text_content:
Tool Name: Sequali
Description: Fast sequencing data quality metrics
Functions: Sequencing quality control, Statistical calculation
Topics: Sequence analysis, Data quality management
Homepage: https://github.com/rhpvorderman/sequali
Documentation:

name: squirrel
text_content:
Tool Name: squirrel
Description: Some QUIck Reconstruction to Resolve Evolutionary Links

Squirrel provides a rapid way of producing reliable alignments for MPXV and also enable maximum-likelihood phylogenetics pipeline tree estimation.
Functions: Sequencing quality control, Phylogenetic analysis
Topics: Virology
Homepage: https://github.com/aineniamh/squirrel
Documentation:

name: EnzymeDetector
text_content:
Tool Name: EnzymeDetector
Description: The EnzymeDetector database offers a comparative and integrative approach to find enzymatic annotations. The most comprehensive databases for protein and genome annotation, namely manually annotated data and text mining data from BRENDA, UniProt, KEGG, PATRIC, and NCBI's RefSeq, are integrated to have a vast view on the organism of interest. The data are complemented with self-performed annotation methods, i.e. BLAST vs. all enzyme annotations from Swiss-Prot and BrEPS enzyme pattern recognition.
Functions: N/A
Topics: Sequence analysis, Enzymes
Homepage: https://ed.brenda-enzymes.org/help.php
Documentation: https://www.brenda-enzymes.org/information/tutorial_training/BRENDA_Tutorial_EnzymeDetector.pdf

name: ARTEMIS
text_content:
Tool Name: ARTEMIS
Description: a method for topology-independent superposition of RNA 3D structures and structure-based sequence alignment
Functions: Nucleic acid structure comparison, Pairwise structure alignment
Topics: Mapping, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, DNA, Nucleic acids, Computational biology, RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/david-bogdan-r/ARTEMIS
Documentation: https://github.com/david-bogdan-r/ARTEMIS/blob/main/README.md

name: NanoMnT
text_content:
Tool Name: NanoMnT
Description: NanoMnT: An STR Analysis Tool for Oxford Nanopore Sequencing Data Driven by a Comprehensive Analysis of Error Profile in STR regions.
Functions: N/A
Topics: N/A
Homepage: https://github.com/18parkky/NanoMnT
Documentation:

name: ISfinder
text_content:
Tool Name: ISfinder
Description: It is a dedicated insertion sequence (IS) database which assigns names to individual ISs to maintain a coherent nomenclature, an IS repositaory including >3000 individual ISs from both bacteria and archaea and provides a basis for IS classification. Each IS is indexed in ISfinder with various associated pieces of information and classified into a group or family to provide some insight into its phylogeny.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis, Bibliography generation, Genome indexing
Topics: Phylogeny, Literature and language, Model organisms, Sequencing, Mobile genetic elements
Homepage: http://www-is.biotoul.fr
Documentation: https://www-is.biotoul.fr/general_information.php

name: SILVA rRNA database
text_content:
Tool Name: SILVA rRNA database
Description: SILVA provides comprehensive, quality checked and regularly updated datasets of aligned small (16S/18S, SSU) and large subunit (23S/28S, LSU) ribosomal RNA (rRNA) sequences for all three domains of life (Bacteria, Archaea and Eukaryota).
Functions: Primer and probe design, Taxonomic classification, Query and retrieval, Sequence alignment
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Biodiversity, Sequence analysis, Probes and primers, Taxonomy, Microbiology, Phylogenetics
Homepage: http://www.arb-silva.de
Documentation: https://www.arb-silva.de/silva-license-information/

name: SILVAngs
text_content:
Tool Name: SILVAngs
Description: SILVAngs is a data analysis service for ribosomal RNA gene (rDNA) amplicon reads from high-throughput sequencing (next-generation sequencing (NGS)) approaches based on an automatic software pipeline. It uses the SILVA rDNA databases, taxonomies, and alignments as a reference. It facilitates the classification of rDNA reads and provides a wealth of results (tables, graphs and sequence files) for download.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence clustering, Statistical calculation, Visualisation, Taxonomic classification, Sequence alignment, Validation
Topics: Taxonomy, Metagenomics, Biodiversity
Homepage: https://www.arb-silva.de/ngs/
Documentation: https://www.arb-silva.de/ngs/service/file/?file=SILVAngs_User_Guide_15_12_15.pdf

name: Marine Metagenomics Portal
text_content:
Tool Name: Marine Metagenomics Portal
Description: The Marine Metagenomics Portal (MMP) hosts the marine databases MarRef, MarDB, MarFun, and SalDB. These databases provide the marine scientific community with openly accessible, comprehensive microbial genomics and metagenomics resources, including high-quality, manually curated sequences. The user-friendly web interface allows visitors to easily navigate and refine searches within the contextual databases and offers additional BLAST searches, visualizations, downloads, and workflows (via META-pipe).
Functions: Sequence annotation, Taxonomic classification, Query and retrieval, Analysis
Topics: Data integration and warehousing, Data mining, Microbial ecology, Bioinformatics, Sequence analysis, Metagenomics, Function analysis, Marine biology, Taxonomy, Genomics
Homepage: https://sfb.mmp2.sigma2.no
Documentation: https://mmp2.sfb.uit.no/terms-of-use/

name: PHIStruct
text_content:
Tool Name: PHIStruct
Description: PHIStruct is a phage-host interaction prediction tool that uses structure-aware protein embeddings to represent the receptor-binding proteins (RBPs) of phages. 

By incorporating structure information, it presents improvements over using sequence-only protein embeddings and feature-engineered sequence properties — especially for phages with RBPs that have low sequence similarity to those of known phages.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Proteomics, Bioinformatics, Machine learning, Virology, Proteins, Computational biology, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/bioinfodlsu/PHIStruct
Documentation: https://github.com/bioinfodlsu/PHIStruct

name: PHIEmbed
text_content:
Tool Name: PHIEmbed
Description: PHIEmbed is a phage-host interaction prediction tool that uses protein language models to represent the receptor-binding proteins of phages. It presents improvements over using handcrafted (manually feature-engineered) sequence properties and eliminates the need to manually extract and select features from phage sequences.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Proteomics, Bioinformatics, Sequence analysis, Machine learning, Virology, Proteins, Computational biology
Homepage: https://github.com/bioinfodlsu/phage-host-prediction
Documentation: https://github.com/bioinfodlsu/phage-host-prediction

name: SCANPY
text_content:
Tool Name: SCANPY
Description: Scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression data. It includes preprocessing, visualization, clustering, pseudotime and trajectory inference and differential expression testing. The Python-based implementation efficiently deals with datasets of more than one million cells.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Cell biology, Genetics, Single-cell sequencing, Gene expression
Homepage: https://github.com/theislab/Scanpy
Documentation: https://scanpy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

name: muon
text_content:
Tool Name: muon
Description: muon is a Python framework for multimodal omics analysis.
Functions: N/A
Topics: Cell biology, Epigenetics, Gene expression, Single-cell sequencing, Multiomics
Homepage: https://muon.scverse.org/
Documentation: https://muon.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html

name: TmPrime
text_content:
Tool Name: TmPrime
Description: Allows users to design oligonucleotide sets for gene assembly by both ligase chain reaction and polymerase chain reaction. The program also provides functions to separate long genes into smaller fragments for multi-pool assembly and codon optimization for expression.
Functions: PCR primer design, Read mapping, Sequence assembly
Topics: Transcription factors and regulatory sites, Sequence assembly, Humans, Gene expression, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://prime.ibn.a-star.edu.sg
Documentation:

name: Bakta
text_content:
Tool Name: Bakta
Description: Rapid & standardized annotation of bacterial genomes, MAGs & plasmids
Functions: Genome annotation
Topics: Bioinformatics, Sequence analysis, Genomics
Homepage: https://github.com/oschwengers/bakta
Documentation: https://github.com/oschwengers/bakta/blob/main/README.md

name: TREND Protein Evolution Function
text_content:
Tool Name: TREND Protein Evolution Function
Description: TREND is a platform that allows researchers to explore protein function and evolution identifying protein features, gene neighborhoods and operons, clustering neighboring genes, and integrating all these data into phylogenomic context and cross-referencing with RefSeq, Pfam, CDD and MiST databases. The platform provides ample opportunities for adjusting each step of the analysis.
Functions: Sequence clustering, Multiple sequence alignment, Protein domain recognition, Sequence classification, Phylogenetic inference, Protein feature detection
Topics: Bioinformatics, Phylogeny, Evolutionary biology, Functional genomics, Protein sites, features and motifs, Microbiology, Phylogenomics
Homepage: http://trend.evobionet.com/
Documentation: http://trend.evobionet.com/help

name: JCat
text_content:
Tool Name: JCat
Description: Tool that can adjust the codon usage of an input sequence to the selected organism. Useful for improving the expression of foreign genes in hosts with different codon usage.
Functions: Codon usage fraction calculation, Codon usage table generation, Codon usage table comparison, Codon usage bias calculation, Codon usage analysis
Topics: Zoology, Model organisms, Gene expression
Homepage: http://www.jcat.de/
Documentation: http://www.jcat.de/Introduction.jsp

name: hictkR
text_content:
Tool Name: hictkR
Description: R bindings for hictk: read .cool and .hic files directly from R
Functions: N/A
Topics: Bioinformatics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/paulsengroup/hictkR
Documentation: https://paulsengroup.github.io/hictkR/

name: Jalview
text_content:
Tool Name: Jalview
Description: Jalview is a free program for multiple sequence alignment editing, visualisation and analysis. Use it to view and edit sequence alignments, analyse them with phylogenetic trees and principal components analysis (PCA) plots and explore molecular structures and annotation.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis, Sequence alignment editing, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Sequence analysis, Data visualisation
Homepage: https://www.jalview.org/
Documentation: https://www.jalview.org/about/citation

name: MMseqs2
text_content:
Tool Name: MMseqs2
Description: MMseqs2 (Many-against-Many sequence searching) is a software suite to search and cluster huge protein and nucleotide sequence sets. MMseqs2 is open source GPL-licensed software implemented in C++ for Linux, MacOS, and (as beta version, via cygwin) Windows. The software is designed to run on multiple cores and servers and exhibits very good scalability. MMseqs2 can run 10000 times faster than BLAST. At 100 times its speed it achieves almost the same sensitivity. It can perform profile searches with the same sensitivity as PSI-BLAST at over 400 times its speed.

MMseqs2 includes Linclust, the first clustering algorithm whose runtime scales linearly With Linclust we clustered 1.6 billion metagenomic sequence fragments in 10 h on a single server to 50% sequence identity.
Functions: Sequence similarity search, Taxonomic classification, Sequence alignment, Sequence clustering
Topics: Sequence analysis, Gene and protein families, Metagenomics, Proteins, Nucleic acids, Taxonomy
Homepage: https://mmseqs.com
Documentation: https://github.com/soedinglab/MMseqs2/blob/master/README.md

name: Gen Seeker
text_content:
Tool Name: Gen Seeker
Description: Gen Seeker is the browser of variants detected in the Czech population included in the Czech digital genome map. 
Although Slavs are the largest European ethnolinguistic group, Slavic and especially Czech genomes are underrepresented in international genomic databases, which limits the ability to understand and interpret specific slavic gene variations.
Functions: Genome analysis
Topics: Genetic variation
Homepage: https://czechgenome.cz/search
Documentation: https://czechgenome.cz/data-info

name: Comparative genometrics CG database
text_content:
Tool Name: Comparative genometrics CG database
Description: Devoted to the characterization of complete chromosome sequences by standardized genometric methods, this website displays for sequenced genomes, three different genometric analyses: the DNA walk and the GC and TA skews during the initial phase. Although primarly focused on prokaryotic chromosomes, the CG website posts genometric information on paradigm plasmids, phages, viruses, and organelles.
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: Comparative genomics, DNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://www2.unil.ch/comparativegenometrics/
Documentation:

name: SIMAP WS
text_content:
Tool Name: SIMAP WS
Description: Database containing the similarity space formed by about all amino-acid sequences from public databases and completely sequenced genomes.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Data retrieval
Topics: Sequence analysis, Data management
Homepage: http://liferay.csb.univie.ac.at/portal/web/simap/webservice
Documentation: http://liferay.csb.univie.ac.at/portal/web/simap/webservice

name: RNAalifoldWS
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAalifoldWS
Description: Predict a consensus secondary structure of a set of aligned sequences.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://rna.tbi.univie.ac.at/cgi-bin/RNAalifold.cgi
Documentation: http://rna.tbi.univie.ac.at/cgi-bin/RNAalifold.cgi

name: SVMHC
text_content:
Tool Name: SVMHC
Description: Prediction of MHC class I binding peptides.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.sbc.su.se/%7Epierre/svmhc/
Documentation:

name: MDR database
text_content:
Tool Name: MDR database
Description: Medium-chain dehydrogenases/reductases database.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bioinfo.ifm.liu.se/services/mdr/
Documentation:

name: DRIP-PRED
text_content:
Tool Name: DRIP-PRED
Description: Disorder/order prediction for proteins.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.sbc.su.se/%7Emaccallr/disorder/cgi-bin/submit.cgi
Documentation:

name: ASePCR
text_content:
Tool Name: ASePCR
Description: Tool for carrying out e-PCR to detect differences in amplicon sizes in transcripts from different tissues and organs.
Functions: Splicing model analysis, Splice transcript prediction
Topics: Sequencing, Model organisms, RNA splicing, Gene expression
Homepage: http://genome.ewha.ac.kr/ASePCR/
Documentation:

name: Pathway Explorer
text_content:
Tool Name: Pathway Explorer
Description: Tool for visualizing high throughput expression data simultaneously with biological pathway data available from KEGG, BioCarta, and GenMAPP.
Functions: Pathway or network analysis, Gene expression profiling, Gene expression profile pathway mapping, Network simulation
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequencing, Gene expression
Homepage: https://pathwayexplorer.genome.tugraz.at/
Documentation:

name: IBM Bioinformatics and Pattern Discovery Group
text_content:
Tool Name: IBM Bioinformatics and Pattern Discovery Group
Description: Extensive server possessing a wide range of tools for pattern discovery in DNA and protein sequences as well as in text. Tools for multiple sequence alignment, gene discovery, protein annotation, and other applications also exist on this server. A detailed help page is provided for all tools.
Functions: Sequence motif discovery, Service discovery, Multiple sequence alignment, Indel detection, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, DNA, Gene and protein families, Protein sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://cbcsrv.watson.ibm.com/Tspd.html
Documentation:

name: REPPER
text_content:
Tool Name: REPPER
Description: Tool for detecting and analysing regions in protein sequences or sequence alignements that have short gapless repeats.
Functions: Repeat sequence organisation analysis, Repeat sequence detection, Sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Protein feature detection
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Gene and protein families, Proteins, Protein sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://protevo.eb.tuebingen.mpg.de/repper
Documentation:

name: TMBETA-NET
text_content:
Tool Name: TMBETA-NET
Description: Tool that predicts transmembrane beta strands in an outer membrane protein from its amino acid sequence.
Functions: Transmembrane protein prediction, Protein subcellular localisation prediction, Protein secondary structure prediction, Transmembrane protein analysis
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Small molecules, Proteins, Structure prediction, Protein folds and structural domains
Homepage: http://psfs.cbrc.jp/tmbeta-net/
Documentation:

name: CE-MC
text_content:
Tool Name: CE-MC
Description: A multiple protein structure alignment server which creates an all-to-all pairwise alignment using a combinatorial extension program and then using Monte Carlo optimization methods conducts an iterative global optimization.  Results are formatted using JOY.
Functions: Global structure alignment, Pairwise sequence alignment, Multiple structure alignment, Pairwise structure alignment
Topics: Structure prediction, Proteins, Protein structure analysis, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.albany.edu/~cemc/
Documentation:

name: INCLUSive
text_content:
Tool Name: INCLUSive
Description: Set of tools for the analysis of gene expression data and the discovery of cis-regulatory sequence elements.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Gene expression QTL analysis, Gene expression analysis, Gene expression correlation analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Gene expression
Homepage: http://www.esat.kuleuven.ac.be/inclusive
Documentation:

name: ASmodeler
text_content:
Tool Name: ASmodeler
Description: Gene modeling server which focuses on the modeling of alternative splicing. It is based on the alignment of mRNA, EST and protein sequences and combines genome-based clustering and transcript assembly.  Supports human, mouse and rat genomes.
Functions: Splicing model analysis, Protein modelling, EST assembly, Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence assembly, Humans, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, RNA splicing
Homepage: http://genome.ewha.ac.kr/ECgene/ASmodeler/
Documentation:

name: PepBuild
text_content:
Tool Name: PepBuild
Description: Tool that facilitates the construction, from known sequence and secondary/tertiary structures, of capped or uncapped proteins. The output generated is in PDB format.
Functions: Structure visualisation, Protein secondary structure analysis, Protein secondary structure comparison
Topics: Proteins, Protein secondary structure, Structure prediction, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://www.imtech.res.in/bvs/pepbuild/
Documentation:

name: Motif3D
text_content:
Tool Name: Motif3D
Description: Protein structure viewer for visualizing sequence motifs contained in the PRINTS database on 3D structures.
Functions: Protein model validation, Protein structure assignment, Protein structure prediction, Protein structural motif recognition, Protein structure analysis
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Structure analysis, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://umber.sbs.man.ac.uk/dbbrowser/motif3d/motif3d.html
Documentation:

name: PepX
text_content:
Tool Name: PepX
Description: Exhaustive data set of all protein-peptide complexes available in the PDB with peptide lengths up to 35 residues. Complexes have been clustered based on their binding interfaces rather than sequence homology, providing a set of structurally diverse protein-peptide interactions. Each complex is annotated with both biological and structural information. Peptides are also annotated with naturally occurring backbone variations using fragment clusters from the BriX database to aid peptide design.
Functions: Clustering, Protein modelling, Peptide database search
Topics: Protein folding, stability and design, Small molecules, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Proteins, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://pepx.switchlab.org/pepx/
Documentation:

name: SeLOX
text_content:
Tool Name: SeLOX
Description: Web server identifies degenerate lox-like sites within genomic sequences.
Functions: Repeat sequence analysis, Genome comparison, Recombination detection, Genome indexing
Topics: Transcription factors and regulatory sites, Humans, Model organisms, Sequencing, Genomics
Homepage: http://selox.mpi-cbg.de/cgi-bin/selox/index
Documentation:

name: PlantLoc
text_content:
Tool Name: PlantLoc
Description: Web server for predicting plant protein subcellular localization by substantiality motif.
Functions: Protein subcellular localisation prediction, Protein feature detection, Protein function prediction
Topics: Plants, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Protein sites, features and motifs, Function analysis
Homepage: http://cal.tongji.edu.cn/PlantLoc/
Documentation:

name: BiForce Toolbox
text_content:
Tool Name: BiForce Toolbox
Description: Webserver for high throughput analysis of pair-wise epistasis in GWAS of quantitative and disease traits.
Functions: Genotyping, Over-representation analysis, Gene expression QTL analysis
Topics: GWAS study, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Quantitative genetics, Sequencing, Pathology
Homepage: http://bioinfo.utu.fi/BiForceToolbox/
Documentation:

name: DSP
text_content:
Tool Name: DSP
Description: Shape string predictor for protein sequences. It provides both predicted shape string and sequence-shape string profile for each query sequence allowing for comparison of protein structure or evolution in shape string space.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction, Protein structure prediction, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein secondary structure prediction (coils), Protein secondary structure comparison
Topics: Proteins, Protein secondary structure, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Structure prediction, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://cheminfo.tongji.edu.cn/dsp/
Documentation:

name: seeMotif
text_content:
Tool Name: seeMotif
Description: Allows users to interactively visualize sequence motifs on protein structures from Protein Data Bank (PDB).
Functions: Sequence motif analysis, Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif comparison, Sequence motif recognition, Protein structural motif recognition
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs, Gene and protein families, Proteins, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://seemotif.csie.ntu.edu.tw
Documentation:

name: TarO
text_content:
Tool Name: TarO
Description: Collection of tools for protein target optimization analysis. Tools include those for annotation of putative orthologues and homologues, searches against the PDB with PSIBLAST, generation of annotated multiple sequence alignments and presentation of integrated results.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Protein fold recognition
Topics: Small molecules, Structure analysis, Proteins, Protein modifications, Protein folds and structural domains
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/taro
Documentation:

name: CRISPRcompar
text_content:
Tool Name: CRISPRcompar
Description: Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats (CRISPR) elements are used in this tool as a genetic marker for comparative and evolutionary analysis of closely related bacterial strains.
Functions: Clustering, Repeat sequence analysis, Genotyping, Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, DNA polymorphism, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Model organisms, Genetics
Homepage: http://crispr.u-psud.fr/CRISPRcompar/
Documentation:

name: FeatureScan
text_content:
Tool Name: FeatureScan
Description: Searches for sequence similarity by comparing physico-chemical properties of DNA such as charge, melting enthalpy, conformational parameters, etc.
Functions: Sequence similarity search, Database search, Sequence database search (by property), Nucleic acid thermodynamic property calculation
Topics: Transcription factors and regulatory sites, DNA, Physics, Gene expression, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://gnaweb.gbf.de/cgi-bin/FeatureScan/FeatureScan.pl
Documentation:

name: HHsenser
text_content:
Tool Name: HHsenser
Description: Tool for sensitive iterative sequence searching based on HMM-HMM comparison. Starting from a single sequence or an alignment, it is able to build alignments with as many near or remote homologs as possible allowing users to explore protein superfamilies.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Sequence alignment comparison
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis, Proteins, Protein sites, features and motifs, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://toolkit.tuebingen.mpg.de/hhsenser
Documentation:

name: SCOPE
text_content:
Tool Name: SCOPE
Description: Set of programs aimed at identifying novel cis-regulatory elements from groups of upstream sequences. It does not have any nuisance parameters so does not require the user to guess what the results might be. It is also very robust to noisy data and is still 50% as accurate even in the presence of 4-fold noise. It can also identify other genes in the genome that might be coregulated with the original gene set.
Functions: Sequence motif discovery, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction, Regulatory element prediction, Transcription factor binding site prediction, Over-representation analysis
Topics: Transcription factors and regulatory sites, Gene regulation, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Gene expression
Homepage: http://genie.dartmouth.edu/scope/
Documentation:

name: One-Block CYRCA
text_content:
Tool Name: One-Block CYRCA
Description: Program for identifying blocks (local ungapped profiles of the most conserved regions of protein families and domains) in a multiple sequence alignment based on the LAMA and CYRCA block-to-block alignment methods.
Functions: Protein fold recognition, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Local alignment, Local structure alignment, Protein feature detection
Topics: Protein binding sites, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Gene and protein families, Structure prediction, Protein folds and structural domains
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.weizmann.ac.il/~milana/OneCYRCA/
Documentation:

name: RNAMST
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAMST
Description: Tool for identifying homologs of a pre-defined RNA structural motif among numerous RNA sequences.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition, RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure prediction, RNA structure prediction, RNA secondary structure analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, RNA, Structure prediction, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://bioinfo.csie.ncu.edu.tw/~rnamst/
Documentation:

name: CHC_FIND
text_content:
Tool Name: CHC_FIND
Description: Tool to analyze conserved hydrophobic contacts (CHC) from multiple structural alignments. In addition to a multiple sequence alignment, a structural alignment which provides the superposition of structurally conserved regions (SCRs) (i.e., results from SCR_FIND) needs to be provided.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Multiple structure alignment, Structure alignment, Protein structural motif recognition
Topics: Gene and protein families, Structure analysis, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Structure prediction, Protein folds and structural domains
Homepage: http://schubert.bio.uniroma1.it/CHC_FIND/index.html
Documentation:

name: PARSESNP
text_content:
Tool Name: PARSESNP
Description: Tool for the analysis of polymorphisms in genes.
Functions: SNP detection, Polymorphism detection, Protein modelling, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, DNA polymorphism, Sequence analysis, Gene transcripts, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.proweb.org/parsesnp/
Documentation:

name: ILM
text_content:
Tool Name: ILM
Description: Server which provides iterated loop matching and maximum weighted matching algorithms for pseudoknot containing RNA secondary structure prediction. Algorithms can apply thermodynamic and comparative information, and thus can be used for either aligned or individual sequences.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction, RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure analysis, Structure visualisation
Topics: Structure prediction, Protein secondary structure, RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://cic.cs.wustl.edu/RNA/
Documentation:

name: hmmstat (genouest)
text_content:
Tool Name: hmmstat (genouest)
Description: Display summary statistics for a profile file.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs
Documentation: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs

name: hmmsim (genouest)
text_content:
Tool Name: hmmsim (genouest)
Description: Collect profile HMM score distributions on random sequences.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs
Documentation: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs

name: hmmsearch (genouest)
text_content:
Tool Name: hmmsearch (genouest)
Description: Search profile(s) against a sequence database.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs
Documentation: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs

name: hmmscan (genouest)
text_content:
Tool Name: hmmscan (genouest)
Description: Search sequence(s) against a profile database.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs
Documentation: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs

name: hmmfetch (genouest)
text_content:
Tool Name: hmmfetch (genouest)
Description: Retrieve profile HMM(s) from a file.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs
Documentation: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs

name: hmmemit (genouest)
text_content:
Tool Name: hmmemit (genouest)
Description: Sample sequence(s) from a profile HMM.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs
Documentation: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs

name: hmmconvert (genouest)
text_content:
Tool Name: hmmconvert (genouest)
Description: Convert between profile HMM file formats.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs
Documentation: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs

name: hmmbuild (genouest)
text_content:
Tool Name: hmmbuild (genouest)
Description: Profile HMM construction from multiple sequence alignments.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs
Documentation: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs

name: hmmalign (genouest)
text_content:
Tool Name: hmmalign (genouest)
Description: Align sequences to a profile HMM.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs
Documentation: http://webservices.genouest.org/opal2/dashboard?command=docs

name: PicXAA-Web
text_content:
Tool Name: PicXAA-Web
Description: Web tool for probablistic alignment of multiple biological sequences using probabilistic non-progressive alignment algorithms. Multiple protein, DNA and RNA sequences may be analyzed.
Functions: Tree-based sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment, Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis, Proteins, DNA, RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://gsp.tamu.edu/picxaa/
Documentation:

name: OrthoSelect
text_content:
Tool Name: OrthoSelect
Description: Web server detects orthologous gene sequences in EST libraries and outputs orthologous gene alignments. Annotations, data matrices for each gene, and the gene alignments may also be visualized.
Functions: Gene prediction, Gene functional annotation
Topics: Sequence analysis, Gene and protein families, Gene transcripts, Phylogeny
Homepage: http://orthoselect.gobics.de
Documentation:

name: Phyloscan
text_content:
Tool Name: Phyloscan
Description: Web server that locates transcription regulating binding sites by exploiting binding site evolutionary conservation and repeats in promoter regions. Mixed aligned and unaligned sequence data may be used.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Transcriptional regulatory element prediction, Transcription factor binding site prediction, Promoter prediction, Protein binding site prediction
Topics: Transcription factors and regulatory sites, Protein binding sites, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, DNA binding sites, Gene expression
Homepage: http://bayesweb.wadsworth.org/phyloscan/
Documentation:

name: 3D-Fun
text_content:
Tool Name: 3D-Fun
Description: Software for predicting enzyme function from structure rather than sequence. Users input protein coordinates in PDB format to which all known protein structures are compared by 3D structural superposition. Superposition results are displayed through interactive graphics.
Functions: Protein modelling, Protein model validation, Protein structure assignment, Protein structure comparison, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Molecular modelling, Proteins, Enzymes, Structure prediction, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://3dfun.bioinfo.pl
Documentation:

name: FGF
text_content:
Tool Name: FGF
Description: Resource for finding gene families given a set of protein sequences by investigating phylogenetic trees, duplication fate, and selective pressure (ka/ks calculations).
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis (gene family prediction), Gene prediction, Phylogenetic tree generation, Phylogenetic tree analysis (natural selection)
Topics: Mapping, Gene and protein families, Phylogeny, Animals, Phylogenetics
Homepage: http://fgf.genomics.org.cn/service/index.jsp
Documentation:

name: mirConnX
text_content:
Tool Name: mirConnX
Description: Web server for inferring, displaying and parsing mRNA and microRNA gene regulatory networks. It combines sequence information with gene expression data analysis to create a disease specific, genome wide regulatory network. Only supports human and mouse.
Functions: Gene expression correlation analysis, Gene expression profiling, Gene expression analysis, Pathway or network prediction, Gene regulatory network analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Pathology
Homepage: http://www.benoslab.pitt.edu/mirconnx
Documentation:

name: PiRaNhA
text_content:
Tool Name: PiRaNhA
Description: Predicts the location of RNA binding residues in protein sequences using a support vector machine. Up to 10 protein sequences may be submitted.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Protein feature detection, Residue interaction prediction
Topics: Protein binding sites, Machine learning, Proteins, Protein sites, features and motifs, RNA
Homepage: http://www.bioinformatics.sussex.ac.uk/PIRANHA
Documentation:

name: SARA
text_content:
Tool Name: SARA
Description: Based on the homonimous program, this server computes pairwise alignment of RNA structures for structure based assignment of RNA function. The server can also be used for RNA pairwise structure alignment.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment, Pairwise structure alignment, RNA structure prediction, Structure alignment, Pairwise sequence alignment
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, RNA, Structural biology, Structure prediction, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://sgu.bioinfo.cipf.es/services/SARA/
Documentation:

name: TMB-Hunt
text_content:
Tool Name: TMB-Hunt
Description: Classifies protein sequences as transmembrane B-barrel (TMB) or non-TMB based on amino acid composition.
Functions: Sequence composition calculation, Protein signal peptide detection, Transmembrane protein prediction, Transmembrane protein analysis, Transmembrane protein visualisation
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Small molecules, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Proteins, Protein folds and structural domains
Homepage: http://bmbpcu36.leeds.ac.uk/~andy/betaBarrel/AACompPred/aaTMB_Hunt.cgi
Documentation:

name: MINER
text_content:
Tool Name: MINER
Description: Tool for the identification and visualization of phylogenetic motifs (regions within a multiple sequence alignment (MSA) that conserve the overall phylogeny of the complete family).
Functions: Tree-based sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Sequence alignment, Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis, Phylogeny, Sequencing, Phylogenetics
Homepage: http://coit-apple01.uncc.edu/MINER/
Documentation:

name: NAST
text_content:
Tool Name: NAST
Description: Multiple sequence alignment server for comparative analysis of 16S rRNA gene sequences from bacteria and archaea.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis, Sequence alignment
Topics: Transcription factors and regulatory sites, Sequence analysis, Probes and primers, Model organisms, Sequencing
Homepage: http://greengenes.lbl.gov/cgi-bin/nph-NAST_align.cgi
Documentation:

name: BioBayesNet
text_content:
Tool Name: BioBayesNet
Description: Server for feature extraction and Bayesian network modeling of biological sequence data.
Functions: Metabolic network modelling, Pathway or network analysis, Network simulation
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis, Systems biology, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://biwww3.informatik.uni-freiburg.de:8080/BioBayesNet/
Documentation:

name: MaM
text_content:
Tool Name: MaM
Description: Takes a multiple alignment of genomic sequences as input and calculates the locations of exons, common repeat elements and unique regions based on user-selected programs/information. The graphical display also allows users to focus an assessment of sequence variation on the identified regions.
Functions: Tree-based sequence alignment, Sequence alignment, Multiple sequence alignment, Genome alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Phylogeny, Gene transcripts, Sequencing
Homepage: http://compbio.cs.sfu.ca/MAM.htm
Documentation:

name: WebTraceMiner
text_content:
Tool Name: WebTraceMiner
Description: Tool for processing and mining Expressed Sequence Tag (EST) trace files. It can help characterize 3&apos, and 5&apos, termini of cDNA inserts by detecting sequence features such as vector fragments, adapter/linker sequences, insert-flanking restriction endonuclease recognition sites, and polyA or polyT tails.
Functions: Vector sequence detection, Sequence feature detection, Restriction site recognition, Protein feature detection
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis, DNA binding sites, Gene transcripts
Homepage: http://www.conifergdb.org/software/wtm1.2/
Documentation:

name: PlotRep
text_content:
Tool Name: PlotRep
Description: Tool for the visual analysis of dispersed genomic repeats. The tool is designed to merge fragments belonging to the same copy of a repeat and allows for the inspection of the results using a dot-plot like graphical output.
Functions: Repeat sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://repeats.abc.hu/cgi-bin/plotrep.pl
Documentation:

name: FatiGOplus
text_content:
Tool Name: FatiGOplus
Description: Tool for the functional profiling of genome-scale experiments oriented to the interpretation of microarray experiments. As part of the Babelomics suite, the tool finds differential distributions of biological terms (GO, KEGG pathways, Interpro motifs, Transfac motifs, CisRed motifs, etc.) between two groups of genes.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition, Gene prediction, Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Microarray experiment, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Gene expression
Homepage: http://www.fatigo.org/
Documentation:

name: ProteoMirExpress
text_content:
Tool Name: ProteoMirExpress
Description: Web server that integrates proteomic and mRNA expression data together to infer miRNA-centered regulatory networks.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Pathway or network analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Systems biology, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks
Homepage: http://jjwanglab.org/proteomirexpress/
Documentation: http://jjwanglab.org/proteomirexpress/help

name: AMPS
text_content:
Tool Name: AMPS
Description: Suite of programs for multiple sequence alignment. The programs include options to incorporate non-sequence information such as secondary structures. It also implements flexible pattern matching and database scanning options, and includes functions for running randomisations to estimate the significance of sequence similarities.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis, Computational biology
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/software.html#msa
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/manuals/amps/amps.html

name: PSI
text_content:
Tool Name: PSI
Description: Web server which performs multiple sequence alignment (MSA) of proteins by combining homology extension with a consistency based alignment approach.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Data management
Homepage: http://tcoffee.crg.cat/apps/tcoffee/do:tmcoffee
Documentation: http://tcoffee.crg.cat/apps/tcoffee/tutorial_tmcoffee.html

name: POPDIST
text_content:
Tool Name: POPDIST
Description: Newly-developed population genetic data analysis program. It calculates a number of different genetic identities, phylogeny reconstructing measures, and distance reconstructing measures.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Phylogenetic tree reconstruction
Topics: Data architecture, analysis and design, Population genetics, Phylogeny, Genetics
Homepage: http://genetics.agrsci.dk/~bernt/popgen/
Documentation: http://genetics.agrsci.dk/~bernt/popgen/#doc

name: RDC-PANDA
text_content:
Tool Name: RDC-PANDA
Description: RDC-based SSE PAcking with NOEs for Structure Determination and NOE Assignment is a suite of programs for nuclear Overhauser effect (NOE) assignment and high-resolution structure determination starting with a global fold calculated from exact solutions to the residual dipolar coupling (RDC) equations. It is specifically designed for automated NMR NOE assignment and protein structure determination.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Structure prediction, NMR, Protein structure analysis, Structural biology
Homepage: http://www.cs.duke.edu/donaldlab/rdcpanda.php
Documentation: http://www.cs.duke.edu/donaldlab/software/rdcpanda/rdc-panda_manual.pdf

name: msa
text_content:
Tool Name: msa
Description: Display multiple-sequence alignment. The tool is also available as R/BioConductor interface to the multiple sequence alignment algorithms ClustalW, ClustalOmega, and Muscle. All three algorithms are integrated in the package, therefore, they do not depend on any external software tools and are available for all major platforms.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Sequencing, Phylogenetics
Homepage: http://msa.biojs.net
Documentation: https://github.com/wilzbach/msa/blob/master/LICENSE

name: Legume Information System (LIS)
text_content:
Tool Name: Legume Information System (LIS)
Description: The Legume Information System enables productive applied and basic research in the legumes by relating data from multiple crop and model species, and by helping researchers traverse among various data types.
Functions: Mapping, Genetic mapping, Gene expression QTL analysis, Physical mapping, Sequence tag mapping
Topics: Mapping, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Gene transcripts, Plant biology, Model organisms
Homepage: http://comparative-legumes.org/
Documentation:

name: I-PV
text_content:
Tool Name: I-PV
Description: Software that uses Circos to render interactive images for protein sequence visualization.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Visualisation
Topics: Proteins, Genetic variation, Data visualisation
Homepage: http://www.i-pv.org/
Documentation: http://www.i-pv.org/#nutShell

name: PMFastR
text_content:
Tool Name: PMFastR
Description: Algorithm which iteratively uses a sequence-structure alignment procedure to build a multiple RNA structure alignment.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment
Topics: RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://genome.ucf.edu/PMFastR/
Documentation: http://genome.ucf.edu/PMFastR/

name: AgilePindelFilter
text_content:
Tool Name: AgilePindelFilter
Description: Enables the rapid filtering, screening and sorting of indel variants derived from an exome sequencing experiment to allow the rapid detection of possible deleterious variants.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Exome sequencing, Population genetics
Homepage: http://dna.leeds.ac.uk/agile/AgilePindelFilter/
Documentation: http://dna.leeds.ac.uk/agile/AgilePindelFilter/guide.php

name: AdaptML
text_content:
Tool Name: AdaptML
Description: Software package that will automatically partition groups of gene sequences according to both their genetic and ecological similarity.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree reconstruction
Topics: Sequence analysis, Phylogenetics
Homepage: http://almlab.mit.edu/adaptml.html
Documentation: http://almlab.mit.edu/adaptml.html

name: 14-3-3-Pred
text_content:
Tool Name: 14-3-3-Pred
Description: Webserver that predicts 14-3-3-binding sites by combining predictions from three different classifiers: ANN, PSSM and SVM.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein binding site prediction
Topics: Protein binding sites
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/1433pred
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/1433pred/about

name: HGTector
text_content:
Tool Name: HGTector
Description: Computational pipeline for genome-wide detection of putative horizontal gene transfer (HGT) events based on sequence homology search hit distribution statistics.
Functions: Sequence comparison, Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis, Genetics, Genomics
Homepage: https://github.com/DittmarLab/HGTector
Documentation: https://github.com/DittmarLab/HGTector/blob/master/README.md

name: iMem-Seq
text_content:
Tool Name: iMem-Seq
Description: Multi-label classifier for identifying membrane proteins with single and multiple types via physical-chemical property matrix and grey-PSSM.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Protein folds and structural domains, Membrane and lipoproteins
Homepage: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/iMem-Seq
Documentation: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/iMem/iMem_readme.html

name: PromFD
text_content:
Tool Name: PromFD
Description: Computer program to recognize vertebrate RNA polymerase II promoters.
Functions: Promoter prediction
Topics: Transcription factors and regulatory sites, Sequence analysis, DNA, RNA, Model organisms
Homepage: http://stormo.wustl.edu/src/PromFD/
Documentation: http://stormo.wustl.edu/src/PromFD/
